name: My Awesome Mod
author: Your Name Here
description: A brief description of what your mod does. This appears in the mod selector.
_comment_dependencies: List mod IDs that must be loaded before this mod. Most mods depend on _base_game.
_comment_load_priority: Priority determines load order and override behavior. Higher numbers load later and can override lower numbers.
_comment_priority_ranges: 0-99: Official content | 100-8999: User mods | 9000-9999: Total conversions
_comment_content: Paths to your mod's data and assets directories (relative to this mod.json file)
_comment_scenes: Register custom scenes by ID. Other mods can override these, and the game can load them by ID.
_comment_custom_types: Extend the game's type systems with your own values. These are used by registries.
_comment_provides: Document what your mod provides. Use '*' for 'all of this type'. This is informational.
_comment_overrides: List resource IDs from other mods that you intentionally override.
_comment_replaces_default_party: Set to true if your mod provides a complete replacement starting party (total conversions).
